result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Charles Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge  for each conviction.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 3/1/2019.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts  two and three; and consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Participate in an HSED or GED program until completed or supervision is completed.
Full time employment/school or a combination of both.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
Comply with all child support Court orders.
Partipate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  DOC must conduct  drug and alcohol testing.

Fine set at zero.
Driver's license suspension is not imposed.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.
The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under S. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advised the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended and that the defendasnt could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and three; and consecutive to any other sentence.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with  counts one and two; and consecutive to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Charles Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Motion for Sentence Credit, received and filed. LNR
Revocation Order and Warant dated 9/9/15 for Racine County case 14CF185, received and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.
Document ordered sealed, signed, received and filed. tk

Defendant Christopher Charles Brown in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Defendant Christopher Charles Brown in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, concurrent with count 2 and count 3 of 15CF1519 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, concurrent with count 1 and count 3 of 15CF1519 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, concurrent with count 1 and count 2 of 15CF1519 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the mandatory  DNA surcharge for each conviction to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 03-01-2019; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Participate in an HSED or GED program until completed or supervision is completed. 
- Full time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting; Notice & Acknowledgement;
Motion to Seal, received and filed. tk

Defendant Christopher Charles Brown in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Brandon Wigley on behalf of Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2 and 3: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered penalty enahncer dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED 2, and AMENDED 3:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 02-22-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Court vacated jury trial on 03-02-2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Christopher Charles Brown not in court, in custody, in holding area.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are still negiotating. For reasons presented to the   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, requests case be set for Motion Hearing, Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. Copies given to state and defense counsel. 

State to provide reports/summary of expert witness no later than 12-07-2015 by 5:00 pm. Motions challenging the admissibility of expert witness due no later than 12-18-2015 by 5:00 pm. 

Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 01-29-2016 at 8:30, and Jury Trial scheduled on 03-02-2016 at 9:00 am, Branch 17. Final pre-trial scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Christopher Charles Brown not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. State in jury trial on another matter. Parties are requesting a joined adjournment for projected plea and sentencing. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing hearing on 11-06-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court. Defendant Christopher Charles Brown not in court, in custody, not produced. Paul Hauer on behalf of Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record.   Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Any motions due no later than 09-29-2015 at 8:30 am. Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing on 09-29-2015 at 08:30 am, Branch 17.   Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed on 6/18/2015.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.  aw

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Christopher Charles Brown not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has just received discovery from prior counsel, and needs time to review it with client.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Substitution filed.  Case assigned to Judge Stark.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/29/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  aw

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Christopher Charles Brown not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.

Attorney Ward has just been appointed, and still needs to receive and review discovery.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/30/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Christopher Charles Brown not in court, in custody.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Charles Brown in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Defendant Christopher Charles Brown in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is not being paid, and request to withdraw.  Court allows attorney Goldmann to withdraw.  Case adjourned for status of counsel on 6/11/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court vacates all other court dates, and will reset when the new lawyer is appointed.  aw

Note:  No action is taken on defense motion to unseal warrant.  State feels we should take up that issue with new counsel.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Clerk contacted parties to reschedule dates due to rotation.  Clerk noticed attorney Goldman has filed some papers to withdraw.  Case adjourned for motion hearing on 6/4/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Withdraw Counsel filed.
Defendant's Motion to Unseal Bench Warrant and Disclosure of Confidential Informant filed.
Stipulation to Withdraw as Counsel filed.

Attorney James E Goldmann in court, defendant Christopher Charles Brown not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense request for a final pretrial date and a jury trial date is granted by the court.  Parties are advised that this case will be reassigned to Br 44 effectivre  08-01-15.  Scheduling order signed and filed.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 03  Motions are to be filed in Br 3 by 05-22-15  Jury trial scheduled for 09-08-2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney James E Goldmann in court, defendant Christopher Charles Brown not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel needs additional discovery and a offer.  State to provide before next court date.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/18/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.   aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Charles Brown in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Defendant Christopher Charles Brown in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Christopher Charles Brown in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Defendant Christopher Charles Brown in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
